definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
military demarcation line MDL/refers to Korean demilitarized zone DMZ
pinyin: ge2 jun1 shi4 fen1 jie4 xian4

sentences.english: The challenge is the boundary of personalisation and privacy.
sentences.chinese: 挑战在于个性化和隐私之间的分界线。

sentences.english: That puts the company right on the fuzzy no man's land between value and growth.
sentences.chinese: 这就使谷歌刚好落在价值股与成长股的分界线上。

sentences.english: The fence marks the boundary between my land and hers.
sentences.chinese: 这道栅子是我的地和她的地的分界线。

sentences.english: The line between good and evil is beginning to blur.
sentences.chinese: 善恶间的分界线已经变得模糊了。

sentences.english: Bingdaban fault is boundary, each other belong to hyperplasia belt of two plates.
sentences.chinese: 以冰达坂断裂为分界线，分别属于两大板块的增生带。

sentences.english: Border is the domain boundary between sovereignties.
sentences.chinese: 边界是主权国家领土分界线。

sentences.english: The dividing line between the two air masses is called a front.
sentences.chinese: 这两股气团的分界线叫锋面。

sentences.english: Find amusement when the occasion arises and sincerity, in the heart forever have clear dividing line.
sentences.chinese: 逢场作戏和真心厮守，在心里永远有明显的分界线。

sentences.english: At the zero-rate boundary, fiscal and monetary policies become one.
sentences.chinese: 在零利率分界线上，财政和货币政策会融为一体。

sentences.english: This will reduce the temptation to fudge on your boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 这将减少你在捏造分界线的机会。

sentences.english: Meritocracy, therefore, is a kind a social divider.
sentences.chinese: 因此，精英制度是一种社会分界线。

sentences.english: The resulting line of control, by and large, remains the de-facto international frontier within Kashmir and, in effect, is accepted by Paksitan and India.
sentences.chinese: 而最终的分界线还是被两国接受的克什米尔国际分界。

sentences.english: Many geographers say that the Ural Mountains form the dividing line between Europe and Asia.
sentences.chinese: 许多地理学家认为，乌拉尔山脉是欧亚两洲的分界线。

sentences.english: The line that divided my country was on my mind almost every day.
sentences.chinese: 这道分割我祖国的分界线几乎每天出现在我的脑海中。

sentences.english: The margins, word and letter spacing represent “boundaries”.
sentences.chinese: 页面的空白，单词和字幕间隔代表一定的分界线。

sentences.english: They often form along the boundary between the dune and thesurface below.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常沿着沙丘与坡面间的分界线分布。

definition: border between countries/line forming the border
Arakan Yoma, mountain range in western Myanmar (Burma)
lit. warp string in weaving/fig. vertical or north-south lines/to pass through/to cross lengthwise/to pierce (esp. north-south or top-to-bottom)
the Ural mountains in Russia, dividing Europe from Asia
